snippet: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell unexpectedly last week, offering hope that some of July’s improvement in job growth could be sustained.
abstract: Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits fell 6,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 361,000; Commerce Department reports United States trade deficit narrowed 10.6 percent in June to $42.9 billion; exports rose 0.9 percent to record $185 billion, while imports fell 1.5 percent to $227.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell unexpectedly last week, offering hope that some of July’s improvement in job growth could be sustained.

headline.seo: New Jobless Claims Fall; G.D.P. Estimate May Rise
headline.main: New Jobless Claims Fall as Trade Deficit Narrows
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Fall as Trade Deficit Narrows
